title: P varies directly with square of Q when R is constant, and inversely with R when Q is constant. When Q = 6 and R = 3 then P = 24. What is P when Q = 8 and R = 4? - Quora

response.answer_text: P = kQ²/R Where k is constant of proportionality. => 24 = k x 6²/3 => k = 3 x 24/36 = 2 If Q = 8 & R = 4, then : P = 2 x 8² /4 = 32 :-)
According to question P=kQ^2/R Where k is constant of proposnality. Now on putting Q=6,R=3 And P=24 gives k=2 When Q=8 and R=4 then, P=2×(8)^2/4 P=32
